publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care.
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers-That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Alex Neil*

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Elaine Smith*

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Elaine Smith, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1169 Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers (lodged on 11 September 2000) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Elaine Smith, Fiona McLeod, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Ms Margo MacDonald

S1M-1169 Tommy Sheridan: Provision of Beta Interferon to MS Sufferers—That the Parliament calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to ensure that beta interferon is made available on the NHS to MS sufferers all over Scotland in order to provide them with the highest levels of MS care. Supported by: Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Elaine Smith, Fiona McLeod, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Ms Margo MacDonald
